018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.String.format;
021import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
022import static java.util.regex.Pattern.compile;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
024import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNonNullArgument;
027
028import java.io.Serial;
029import java.io.Serializable;
030import java.util.Collection;
031import java.util.HashMap;
032import java.util.HashSet;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.Set;
036import java.util.function.Function;
037import java.util.regex.Pattern;
038import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;
039
040import org.apiguardian.api.API;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception.ImpossibleExceptionError;
043
044/**
045 *  <p>{@summary An instance of this class is basically a wrapper around a
046 *  String that contains placeholders (&quot;Variables&quot;) in the form
047 *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>, where &lt;<i>name</i> is the variable
048 *  name.}</p>
049 *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
050 *  <p>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the letters
051 *  from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from '0' to '9' and
052 *  the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'), after an optional
053 *  prefix character.</p>
054 *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal sign
055 *  ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
056 *  ('&amp;').</p>
057 *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
058 *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a special
059 *  variable.</p>
060 *
061 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
062 *  @version $Id: Template.java 977 2022-01-06 11:41:03Z tquadrat $
063 *  @since 0.1.0
064 */
065@SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
066@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Template.java 977 2022-01-06 11:41:03Z tquadrat $" )
067@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
068public class Template implements Serializable
069{
070        /*-----------*\
071    ====** Constants **========================================================
072        \*-----------*/
073    /**
074     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
075     *  {@value}.
076     *
077     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
078     *  @see #findVariables()
079     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
080     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
081     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
082     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
083     *  @see #replaceVariable(Function)
084     *
085     *  @since 0.1.0
086     */
087    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
088    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
089    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = "\\$\\{((?:_)|(?:[~/=%:&]?\\p{IsAlphabetic}(?:\\p{IsAlphabetic}|\\d|_|.)*?))}";
090
091    /**
092     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
093     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
094     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
095     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
096     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
097     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
098     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
099     *  ('&amp;').<br>
100     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
101     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
102     *  special variable.
103     *
104     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
105     *
106     *  @since 0.1.0
107     */
108    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
109    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = "${%1$s}";
110
111        /*------------*\
112    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
113        \*------------*/
114    /**
115     *  The template text.
116     *
117     *  @serial
118     */
119    private final String m_TemplateText;
120
121        /*------------------------*\
122    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
123        \*------------------------*/
124    /**
125     *  The pattern that is used to identify a variable in a char sequence.
126     *
127     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
128     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
129     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
130     *  @see #findVariables()
131     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
132     */
133    private static final Pattern m_VariablePattern;
134
135    /**
136     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
137     *
138     *  @hidden
139     */
140    @Serial
141    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
142
143    static
144    {
145        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
146        try
147        {
148            m_VariablePattern = compile( VARIABLE_PATTERN );
149        }
150        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
151        {
152            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
153        }
154    }
155
156        /*--------------*\
157    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
158        \*--------------*/
159    /**
160     *  Creates a new instance of {@code Template}.
161     *
162     *  @param  templateText    The template text, containing variable in the
163     *      form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>.
164     */
165    public Template( final CharSequence templateText )
166    {
167        m_TemplateText = requireNonNullArgument( templateText, "templateText" ).toString();
168    }   //  Template()
169
170        /*---------*\
171    ====** Methods **==========================================================
172        \*---------*/
173    /**
174     *  Escapes backslash ('\') and dollar sign ('$') for regex replacements.
175     *
176     *  @param  s   The source string.
177     *  @return The string with the escaped characters.
178     *
179     *  @see java.util.regex.Matcher#appendReplacement(StringBuffer,String)
180     *
181     *  @since 0.1.0
182     */
183    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
184    private static String escapeRegexReplacement( final CharSequence s )
185    {
186        assert nonNull( s ) : "s is null";
187
188        //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
189        final var len = s.length();
190        final var retValue = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
191        char c;
192        EscapeLoop: for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
193        {
194            c = s.charAt( i );
195            switch( c )
196            {
197                case '\\':
198                case '$':
199                    retValue.append( '\\' ); // The fall through is intended here!
200                    //$FALL-THROUGH$
201                default: // Do nothing ...
202            }
203            retValue.append( c );
204        }   //  EscapeLoop:
205
206        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
207        return retValue.toString();
208    }   //  escapeRegexReplacement()
209
210    /**
211     *  Collects all the variables of the form
212     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
213     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
214     *  {@link Set}
215     *  will be returned.<br>
216     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
217     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
218     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
219     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
220     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
221     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
222     *  ('&amp;').<br>
223     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
224     *  special variable.
225     *
226     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
227     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
228     *
229     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
230     *
231     *  @since 0.0.5
232     */
233    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
234    public static final Set<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
235    {
236        final Collection<String> buffer = new HashSet<>();
237        if( nonNull( text ) )
238        {
239            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
240            String found;
241            while( matcher.find() )
242            {
243                found = matcher.group( 1 );
244                buffer.add( found );
245            }
246        }
247        final var retValue = Set.copyOf( buffer );
248
249        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
250        return retValue;
251    }   //  findVariables()
252
253    /**
254     *  Collects all the variables of the form
255     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the adjusted template.<br>
256     *  <br>If there are not any variables in there, an empty
257     *  {@link Collection}
258     *  will be returned.<br>
259     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
260     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
261     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
262     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
263     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
264     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
265     *  ('&amp;').<br>
266     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
267     *  special variable.
268     *
269     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
270     *
271     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
272     */
273    public final Set<String> findVariables()
274    {
275        final var retValue = findVariables( m_TemplateText );
276
277        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
278        return retValue;
279    }   //  findVariables()
280
281    /**
282     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains the variable of
283     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
284     *  given in
285     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN})
286     *  with the given name.
287     *
288     *  @param  name    The name of the variable to look for.
289     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains the variable,
290     *      {@code false} otherwise.
291     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given argument is not valid as
292     *      a variable name.
293     *
294     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
295     */
296    public final boolean hasVariable( final String name )
297    {
298        if( !isValidVariableName( name ) ) throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "%s is not a valid variable name", name ) );
299
300        final var retValue = findVariables().contains( name );
301
302        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
303        return retValue;
304    }   //  hasVariable()
305
306    /**
307     *  Checks whether the given String contains at least one variable of the
308     *  form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern given in
309     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
310     *
311     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
312     *  @return {@code true} if the String contains at least one variable,
313     *      {@code false} otherwise.
314     *
315     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
316     *
317     *  @since 0.1.0
318     */
319    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
320    public static final boolean hasVariables( final CharSequence s )
321    {
322        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).find();
323
324        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
325        return retValue;
326    }   //  hasVariables()
327
328    /**
329     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains at least one variable of
330     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
331     *  given in
332     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
333     *
334     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains at least one variable,
335     *      {@code false} otherwise.
336     *
337     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
338     */
339    public final boolean hasVariables() { return hasVariables( m_TemplateText ); }
340
341    /**
342     *  Test whether the given String is a valid variable name.
343     *
344     *  @param  name    The bare variable name, without the surrounding
345     *      &quot;${&hellip;}&quot;.
346     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid for a variable name,
347     *      {@code false} otherwise.
348     *
349     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
350     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
351     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
352     *
353     *  @since 0.1.0
354     */
355    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
356    public static final boolean isValidVariableName( final CharSequence name )
357    {
358        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ) );
359        if( retValue )
360        {
361            final var text = format( VARIABLE_TEMPLATE, name );
362            retValue = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text ).matches();
363        }
364
365        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
366        return retValue;
367    }   //  isValidVariableName()
368
369    /**
370     *  Checks whether the given String is a variable in the form
371     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code>, according to the pattern provided
372     *  in
373     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}.
374     *
375     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
376     *  @return {@code true} if the given String is not {@code null}, not the
377     *      empty String, and it matches the given pattern, {@code false}
378     *      otherwise.
379     *
380     *  @since 0.1.0
381     */
382    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
383    public static final boolean isVariable( final CharSequence s )
384    {
385        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).matches();
386
387        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
388        return retValue;
389    }   //  isVariable()
390
391    /**
392     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
393     *  in the given String with values from the given maps. The method will
394     *  try the maps in the given sequence.<br>
395     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
396     *  replaced at all.<br>
397     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
398     *  will not be replaced.<br>
399     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
400     *  <br>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
401     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
402     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
403     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
404     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
405     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
406     *  ('&amp;').<br>
407     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
408     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
409     *  special variable.
410     *
411     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
412     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
413     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
414     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
415     *
416     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
417     *
418     *  @since 0.1.0
419     */
420    @SafeVarargs
421    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
422    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Map<String,?>... sources )
423    {
424        requireNonNullArgument( sources, "sources" );
425
426        final var retValue = replaceVariable( text, variable -> retrieveVariableValue( variable, sources ) );
427
428        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
429        return retValue;
430    }   //  replaceVariable()
431
432    /**
433     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
434     *  in the adjusted template with values from the given maps and returns it
435     *  after formatting the result. The method will try the maps in the given
436     *  sequence.<br>
437     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
438     *  replaced at all.<br>
439     *  <br>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
440     *  will not be replaced.<br>
441     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
442     *  <br>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
443     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
444     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
445     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
446     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
447     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
448     *  ('&amp;').<br>
449     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
450     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
451     *  special variable.
452     *
453     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
454     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
455     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
456     *
457     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
458     */
459    @SafeVarargs
460    public final String replaceVariable( final Map<String,?>... sources )
461    {
462        final var retValue = replaceVariable( m_TemplateText, sources );
463
464        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
465        return retValue;
466    }   //  replaceVariable()
467
468    /**
469     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
470     *  in the adjusted template with values returned by the given retriever
471     *  function for the variable name, and returns it after formatting the
472     *  result.<br>
473     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
474     *  replaced at all.<br>
475     *  <br>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
476     *  itself, this will not be replaced.<br>
477     *  <br>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
478     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
479     *  always be replaced with the same value.<br>
480     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
481     *  <br>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the
482     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
483     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
484     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
485     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
486     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
487     *  ('&amp;').<br>
488     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
489     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
490     *  special variable.
491     *
492     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
493     *      values for the given variable names.
494     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
495     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
496     *
497     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
498     */
499    public final String replaceVariable( final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
500    {
501
502        final var retValue = replaceVariable( m_TemplateText, retriever );
503
504        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
505        return retValue;
506    }   //  replaceVariable()
507
508    /**
509     *  Replaces the variables of the form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>
510     *  in the given String with values returned by the given retriever
511     *  function for the variable name.<br>
512     *  <br>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
513     *  replaced at all.<br>
514     *  <br>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
515     *  itself, this will not be replaced.<br>
516     *  <br>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
517     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
518     *  always be replaced with the same value.<br>
519     *  <br>The variables names are case-sensitive.<br>
520     *  <br>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the
521     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
522     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
523     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
524     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
525     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
526     *  ('&amp;').<br>
527     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
528     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
529     *  special variable.
530     *
531     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
532     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
533     *      values for the given variable names.
534     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
535     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
536     *
537     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
538     *
539     *  @since 0.1.0
540     */
541    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
542    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
543    {
544        requireNonNullArgument( retriever, "retriever" );
545
546        final Map<String,String> cache = new HashMap<>();
547
548        String retValue = null;
549        if( nonNull( text ) )
550        {
551            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
552            final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
553            while( matcher.find() )
554            {
555                final var variable = matcher.group( 0 );
556                final var replacement = cache.computeIfAbsent( variable, v -> escapeRegexReplacement( retriever.apply( matcher.group( 1 ) ).orElse( v ) ) );
557                matcher.appendReplacement( buffer, replacement );
558            }
559            matcher.appendTail( buffer );
560            retValue = buffer.toString();
561        }
562
563        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
564        return retValue;
565    }   //  replaceVariable()
566
567    /**
568     *  Tries to obtain a value for the given key from one of the given
569     *  sources that will be searched in the given sequence order.
570     *
571     *  @param  name    The name of the value.
572     *  @param  sources The maps with the values.
573     *  @return An instance of
574     *      {@link Optional}
575     *      that holds the value from one of the sources.
576     */
577    @SafeVarargs
578    private static final Optional<String> retrieveVariableValue( final String name, final Map<String,?>... sources )
579    {
580        assert nonNull( name ) : "name is null";
581        assert nonNull( sources ) : "sources is null";
582
583        Optional<String> retValue = Optional.empty();
584
585        //---* Search the sources *--------------------------------------------
586        Object value = null;
587        SearchLoop: for( final var map : sources )
588        {
589            value = map.get( name );
590            if( nonNull( value ) ) break SearchLoop;
591        }   //  SearchLoop:
592
593        if( nonNull( value ) )
594        {
595            //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
596            retValue = Optional.of( value.toString() );
597        }
598
599        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
600        return retValue;
601    }   //  retrieveVariableValue()
602}
603//  class Template
604
605/*
606 *  End of File
607 */
